question: Which continent houses the French overseas region "French Guiana"?
explanation: French Guiana is the overseas department and region of France located in the South American continent facing the Atlantic Ocean. It borders Brazil to the east and south and Suriname to the west. French Guiana is the only territory of mainland Americas to have full integration in a European country. It is the second-largest region of France and the largest outermost region within the European Union.
